response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease two 9‑inch round cake pans and line the bottoms with parchment. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into a bowl. Set aside, ensuring all dry components are fully combined, to guarantee an even crumb and tender interior for.",
  "step2": "In a separate large mixing bowl, whisk melted butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract, then blend in buttermilk and sour cream, creating a rich, glossy batter ready for incorporation with dry ingredients in this mixture.",
  "step3": "Gradually pour the wet batter into the dry mixture, folding gently with a spatula. Avoid over‑mixing; stop when just combined. Fold in chopped chocolate, chocolate chips, or espresso powder for depth. The batter should appear thick, moist, and glossy, promising a dense, fudgy crumb that will melt on tongues deliciously.",
  "step4": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Tap pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Bake in the preheated oven for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center emerges with moist crumbs. Rotate pans halfway and watch them rise.",
  "step5": "Allow cakes to cool in pans for ten minutes, then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely. Meanwhile, whisk together powdered sugar, cocoa powder, melted butter, heavy cream, and a pinch of salt until smooth and spreadable. Adjust consistency with extra cream if needed for a silky frosting texture.",
  "step6": "Place the first cake layer on a serving plate, spread a generous pool of chocolate frosting evenly. Top with the second layer, then frost the top and sides, creating a smooth finish. Garnish with chocolate shavings or berries, slice, and serve to eight delighted guests and enjoy the rich flavor."
}
